author: GeeLaw
body: # Steps to reproduce ```powershell 1..100 | foreach { Write-Progress -Activity 'Test' -PercentComplete $_ -Id 100 -Status 'Sleeping' sleep -Milliseconds 200 } Write-Progress -Activity 'Test' -Id 100 -Completed ``` # Expected behavior The same result as it is on Windows PowerShell, respecting the colors. # Actual behavior # Environment data ```none Name Value ---- ----- PSVersion 6.1.2 PSEdition Core GitCommitId 6.1.2 OS Darwin 18.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 18.2.0: Th... Platform Unix PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0 ``` `$Host.PrivateData` has the following value (they're customized): ```none ErrorForegroundColor : White ErrorBackgroundColor : Red WarningForegroundColor : Black WarningBackgroundColor : Yellow DebugForegroundColor : Cyan DebugBackgroundColor : Black VerboseForegroundColor : DarkYellow VerboseBackgroundColor : Black ProgressForegroundColor : Yellow ProgressBackgroundColor : DarkCyan ``` The colors I am using.

comments.author: GeeLaw

comments.author: r-darwish
comments.body: I checked 6.2.3. It's broken in both macOS and Linux and works as expected in Windows. I should note that I used macOS's iTerm to connect to Linux via SSH. I did not test it on an actual Linux terminal such as xterm.

title: [Bug] `Write-Progress` does not respect the progress colors
